lines: Salutations to the one who wears the king of serpents (Nāga) as a garland
Salutations to the one who is smeared with the ashes
Salutations to the one who wears the directions as his clothes
To the one who is adorned with water and sandalwood
To the one who is worshipped
To the Lord of Nandi (the bull)
To the Lord of the Pramathas (spirits or attendants)
To the one adorned with Mandara flowers
To the one adorned with many flowers
To the one who is worshipped well
To the one with the face of Gauri (Goddess Parvati)
To the one who destroyed Daksha’s sacrifice
To the one with the blue throat
To the one with the bull as his banner
To the one born from the pot
To the one who is the son of Gautama
To the leader of the sages
To the one who is worshipped
To the one with a crown
To the universal form of fire
To the one with an eye
To the one with a true form
To the one with matted hair
To the one who holds the Pinaka (bow)
To the one who is without clothes, clad in the directions
